pr_title: Makes solr config auto include required files if not specified

timeline.author: rzwiefel

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Shouldn't we include the collection name in the temporary folder so two clients creating different collections do not partially overwrite each other?
timeline.author: pklinef

replies.bodyText:
Never mind.  The directory will have a random number added to it.
https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk8u/blob/5ca4d2a8ca68334a9f7323ebf9f5a259cee6f6ff/jdk/src/share/classes/java/nio/file/TempFileHelper.java#L57-L65
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❔ Does this work better for different platforms?
timeline.author: shaundmorris

replies.bodyText: Yes, I believe this is the 'best practice' way to use Paths.get since it will insert the separator automatically, saving you from needing to hardcode it.
replies.author: rzwiefel

timeline.bodyText: ❔ If something else goes wrong in there do you need to make sure that tempConfigDir is closed?
timeline.author: shaundmorris

replies.bodyText: The nice thing about using a temp directory is though we might make a couple of them (if multiple attempts are made or if something goes wrong), since its a temp directory the OS will clean it out (at a minimum) when restarted. The overhead isn't very high, so it should never accumulate into a problem.  The delete on exit is just an optimistic way to clean it out possibly sooner.
replies.author: rzwiefel

timeline.bodyText: ❔ Same here. Since you are not returning the tempConfigDir do you need to make sure it is closed?
timeline.author: shaundmorris

replies.bodyText: roger, not sure why I was missing the TempDirectory
